Oku-Yagen and Yagen Onsen are just two kilometers apart and connected by a paved road and a forest trail.  Most of the time it will be faster to walk than wait for the bus.

value: (夫婦かっぱの湯), near the end of the paved road, is a modern state-funded operation offering sex-segregated open-air baths with dressing rooms and showers.  Open 8:30 AM to 18 PM daily except Tuesday.  Entrance fee is only 200 Yen for adults.

(かっぱの湯) is the original hot spring, past the bridge at a fork of the river.  The baths consists of two bare-bones dressing cabins and a large rock pool of hot water.  No services, but no entry charges either and always open.

There are no dressing rooms or other concessions to modesty here, but the views of the Otaki rapids are unparalleled and more often than not you'll have it all to yourself.
